column4: How can I update my exiting RythmBox to next stable version using terminal ?
if you're lucky, you can find one in PPA. rhythmbox has lots of gnome dependencies if I'm not mistaken
bazhang: which player do you guys use ?
i'm not the music-listener type, but right now I have rhythmbox installed with my Unity-based 11.04
I remember using Audacious when I was in Jackalope
bazhang: syockit weird, you don't listen to music. anyways i'm downloading this .tar.gz of rythembox 0.13, i need to overwrite the existing one.
not a directory?
yes, not a directory, just a executable file
what does it output in terminal? maybe it segfaulted
cannot execute binary file
yay it happily runs on my 32-bit! Yeehaw!
might be corrupted download. redownload, it's small, worth the try
XMMS2 is actually a player daemon/server, which needs a client to interface with, and has loads of installable plugins for you to play with, for the best hellish customization

if you're lucky, you might get the plugins you want for audacious. I don't know just what "audacious-plugins" package provides. It lists many audio output, and at the end has this "And many more!" line that makes me wonder. It may or may not contain the "31-band EQ"
ok, i will install audacious'
yes, i am searching
https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/rhythmbox/+bug/472985

it seems that upstream has it fixed. The patch is somewhere in https://bugzilla.gnome.org/show_bug.cgi?id=166020 . You may request someone with technical debian knowledge to try apply patch to glib package
huh!!
yup, that difficult to get things fixed. maybe I can try, I need to set up my build service first. It's been a long time since fixing debian packages
btw by tracing the bug reports, the problem seems to reside in glib
yes, i should see the glib updaets
have you enabled the backports repo?
no
